result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brenton Lewis Pierce

defendant.name: Pierce, Brenton Lewis
defendant.address: 1170 South Erie Street, De Pere, WI 54115

records.addlTxt: No contact with A.A.P. lifted in its entirety.

Prosecuting attorney Natalie M. Mulvey in court for the State of Wisconsin. AP in court to address lifting the no contact.
AP requests the no contact to be lifted
State takes no position.
Court grants AP's request.

Cash previously posted.
Court modifies conditions to allow telephone contact or third party contact to exchange children.  Parties not to discuss the case.
All prior conditions remain.

Defendant Brenton Lewis Pierce in court.  
Prosecuting attorney Natalie M. Mulvey in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant trying to retain private counsel, needs more time
Defendant wants no contact lifted; Victim A.P. appears and asks that no contact be lifted.  State takes no position.
Court modifies bond.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bond posted at jail already.
Defendant to have no contact with A.A.P. or their residence or place of employment.
Absolute sobriety.

Defendant Brenton Lewis Pierce in court.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Charles Greene in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant requests the case be dismissed.
Court finds probable cause.
Court denies motion to dismiss.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
